inclusion.criterion: Healthy and overweight individuals with a BMI between 20-29.9 kg/m²
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Preferably have one bowel movement per day
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Willing to consume prepared study foods (breakfast, lunch dinner, snacks) for a period of 3 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Men and pre-menopausal, non-pregnant or non-lactating women
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Non-vegetarian, non-smoking, and alcohol intake ≤8 drinks/week, and willing to consume 8 drinks per week or less during the course of the study.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: If consuming probiotic containing foods, willing to discontinue eating same, and substitute with non-probiotic containing foods
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Quantity of L. reuteri in screening fecal sample below 10^4 CFU/g
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: History of diabetes, acute or chronic GI illnesses, conditions, or history of GI surgical intervention
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Antibiotic treatment in the last 3 months
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Use of dietary supplements (including prebiotics and probiotics, fiber supplements/bars, digestive enzymes/beano)- if consumed, willing to undergo 4 week pre-intervention washout period, and remain free of supplements for duration of study.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Use of antihypertensive, lipid-lowering, anti-diabetic, anti-inflammatory (i.e corticosteroids or chronic NSAID use), or laxative medications
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Known food allergies or intolerances (including dairy allergic or lactose intolerant)
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has V. cholerae in stool, indicating a GI illness.
